definition: against one's will/willy-nilly
bent/crooked/wrong
surname Qu
tune/song/CL:支[zhi1]
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself

sentences.chinese: 有些妻子曲意奉承丈夫。

sentences.english: The boys fell over themselves trying to get Rosa's attention.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩子曲意奉承羅莎以求青睞。

sentences.english: Jack insinuated himself into her favour.
sentences.chinese: 傑克曲意巴結，贏得了她的歡心。

sentences.english: Success comes from standing out, not fitting in.
sentences.chinese: 成功來自脫穎而出，而非曲意迎合。

sentences.english: No other man ever stooped to flatter her so much.
sentences.chinese: 任何人也沒有像他一樣對她那麼曲意奉承。

definition: to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
(honorific) to greet/to fawn
to cater to sb to make them happy (esp. of one's parents)
to flatter/to toady
to put on an attitude/to pose
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to act with diligent care
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to thank with a gift
to let oneself go/to do as much as one pleases
to do sth to one's heart's content
to deign/to condescend/to yield to (entreaties)/to submit to (sb)/(polite) to deign to accept (a post)
(literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully
to fawn (as flatterer)
